title: Draven skins and what they tell about the players
body:
Saw some of these skin things on another board and thought it was hilarious, but they stopped so I wanna continue them.

Normal Draven Skin: Can either go two ways. 1: This player is new to Draven, and if he's on free week you should be cautious of this players ability to Draven. 2: Familier with ADC roles, just unfamilier to Draven. Can expect mediocre to lackluster play, but he won't feed. He'll just be VERY VERY focused on gaining Adoration. Don't worry about him too much, just have your Jungler gank to cash in those stacks. 

Soul Reaver Draven: A very self conscious Draven. Soul Reavers will usually erupt on you if you even mention their CS/Stack count and will have the largest ego that you'll see. Don't speak to a Soul Reaver, but acknowledge his presence and give him praise, or else expect the Salt Reaver. 

Gladiator Draven: You know you've found a good Draven when you have a Gladiator on your team. Gladiator Draven WANTS to win. Gladiator Draven is CAPABLE of CARRYING the team to victory. If your team loses, you cannot blame his Draven mechanics, because chances are, those weren't the reasons for your defeat. 

Primetime Draven: You have found probably the most charismatic and mirthful character on your team if you see the Primetime. His Draven skills aren't bad, they aren't spectacular, but his humor is IMPECCABLE. You will be laughing with tears from this Draven's sense of humor, whether it be in defeat, in victory or just in the laning phase. You will thumbs up Primetime for being a good sport, even if he does feed, because he has the unnatural ability to make people laugh in League of Legends. 

w00t{{champion:119}}

replies.body:
If this gets enough attention, I'll start making more, starting with {{champion:75}} {{champion:157}} and{{champion:63}} .

Have good ideas swimming for them

You're right. I've learned the error of my ways.
Doesn't that mean "shit"?
It does mean shit. But people think it means babe... Idk why

Nah, I use soul reaver and I have a non-existent ego. I admit I'm bad. :)

Wait a minute.....

'Pulls off draven mask'

{{champion:432}} 

Get back in support you bard main
Hey , I am offended.
WOWOOHOHOHOHOHO A BARD MAIN ???
Always remember: if you see an Iron Defender Leona, you've already lost bot.
I like this idea. It might not be practical per se but it is very funny and I can't help but wonder what you'd say about champions I like >:D

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=XKiI2khW,comment-id=001f,timestamp=2015-05-12T04:31:56.629+0000)
>
> I like this idea. It might not be practical per se but it is very funny and I can't help but wonder what you'd say about champions I like >:D

Thanks Kindlejack! Give me a Champion that you like and it might come soon ;)

So far I'm seeing a lot of requests, which I appreciate so much and is tons of fun. I see a few {{champion:31}}  requests throughout my posts, he might be here next.
No special treatment, tend to your fans and I'll enjoy whatever you write >:)
Why are Gladiator Dravens are usually really experienced and Pulse Fire Ezreals are usually noobish? Do you think types of people but a certain type of skin?

Pulsefire Ezreals are almost universally using the skin to compensate for the fact that they are bad at him, but it is such a well known habit that it now has a negative stigma of "noobs use this skin".

At least, that is the popular opinion of the skin.
Please do Nasus next xD, I saw both posts and I'm just cracking a smile as wide as Sona's hips.

How about those skins you see and you know you're fucking fucked?

Vizier Malzahar.  Traditional Trundle.  Nunu Bot.  White Mage Veigar.  Grandma Warwick.  Most of the vintage skins are a nightmare if they're real vintage.  Not all of them, Assassin Yi is always hilariously bad.

I've never seen Alice in Wonderland Annie or Gentleman Cho'gath do good though.

Me and my brother like to play Primetime Draven and Dunkmaster Darius together on the same team. We then talk throughout the entire match about how awesome we are. Some people love it, others hate. One thing is certain: We win.
http://31.media.tumblr.com/d3f011b70e0c315994f5ed4d3ff438ba/tumblr_ndxg7kF1wB1tr3fqlo1_400.gif

I play with gladiator for one reason and one reason only. The crowd cheering after recalling from a double kill just feels so good. While your analysis isnt set in stone (I've seen plenty of cocky assholes playing with primetime because its the most expensive skin, and plenty of good dravens using soulreaver) overall its fairly accurate from all the other dravens i've seen.
Soul Reaver : I don't like his mustache and it was on sale for 487 RP (yes, it used to have a DECENT price)
I play soul reaver because I got it on sale and thought it was funny to have with my friend playing championship thresh. Other than that I generally just silently go where I'm needed.

You know gladiator Dravens are good because they have the guts to pick the ugliest skin. :P

I'm a primetime myself, and proud.

Hahahaha nice one :D :D But honestly I almost always shit my pants when I see Soul Reaver Draven in enemy team, he kinda scares me more than the Gladiator one and usually, Soul Reavers are fed as fuck.

And yes, every single Soul Reaver cries for a Championship Thresh ;)
I have prime time, but I dont ADC much, LOL

pretty much ya
i always chose gladiator because I think it looks the best though.
Or the Soul Reaver Draven hopes they get a championship thresh lol

Every gladiator Draven I see feeds.
Actually, in this meta, all I see Draven do is feed.

Default: new to Draven

Soul Reaver: is a kid with a big ego

Gladiator: you have found him. The best Draven player you'll ever see. Praise him for he shall deliver us from this elo.

Primetime: jumped the bandwagon after losing to a Draven. Usually bad
Do nidalee pls
I just think soul reaver is the coolest out of those, but I'm a "gladiator draven" player

> Normal Draven Skin: Can either go two ways. 1: This player is new to Draven, and if he's on free week you should be cautious of this players ability to Draven.

Tell that to the Draven that almost screwed up my winning streak and the one who actually carried his team and ruined my winning streak ;-;

what am i

RIP Poor people.
Some dravens without skins are good, they just don't feel like giving money to riot. This applies to all champions.

Thanks for the feedback everyone!!

My 2 cents

4) Let' s be honest here, this is for who has taste.

otherwise it was a good upvote m8, do more!

the soul reaver bit is too true

soul reaver dravens are the ones who push bot all game like nasus, get grouped on, then act like their team should have been there. soul reaver dravens will start to feed/afk if you say anything negative about them. soul reaver dravens are the ones you need to protect hard as hell after lane phase if he's ahead (and even if he isnt) because he'll go ham as hell on any enemy unit within auto range, even if that enemy's a 10/0/30 sejuani.

I saw something like this back on ye olde GD. I prefer that version of primetime tho:

{{champion:119}} "Durr what's axe catching I thought you could only Q once?"

I'm astonished on how right this was!

I always thought the same things!
Soul-reaver: Always jerks who barely speak english.
Gladiator Draven: Dear lord, this guys always dominate, always.
Primetime, I've yet to see another primetime, but being a primetime myself I can agree that I'm cracking jokes almost all match, and am pretty good but not nearly as good as gladiators. :p

So funny to see other people thought the exact same lol.
Man, now I wanna go play draven.
